titles.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4775) making supplemental appropriations for further recovery from and response to terrorist attacks on the United States for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2002, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-486, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

In addition to the amendments considered as adopted pursuant to H. Res. 428, the further amendments adopted in the Committee of the Whole and the amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 165.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 431.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 201 (Roll no. 204).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/24/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 4775 (FY 2002 supplemental appropriations for further recovery from and response to U.S. terrorist attacks and American service members' protection).
